title: Actually, I quite liked it...
review:
I have to admit, the only reason is an interview Courtney Thorne-Smith gave back in '98 on the Conan show (plugging this film) during which she had the misfortune to have Norm MacDonald as the preceding guest. He proceeded to excoriate this film, Carrot Top, and, by implication, the film industry, modern civilization, and the nature of existence itself with admirable aplomb. See here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lL0WayC7jW0

It's funnier than the film. MacDonald is incredible. He actually got me to watch a Carrot Top movie based on his sight-unseen opinion of the film.

Courtney: "It's like 9 1/2 Weeks, but Carrot Top."

Norm: "So, it's like 9 1/2 Seconds?" (long pause) "'Cause he prematurely ejaculated."

Seriously, watch the interview.

title: So bad I can't watch it all the way through
review: There are many mysteries in life.  For example:  Why did any of the people other than Carrot Top agree to appear in this movie?  Why did anyone distribute this movie?  Why did anyone pay money to see it?  I guess none of these questions will ever be answered, but one thing I know for sure, this movie is one of the worst ever made with a budget this big.  It would already be bad, but the addition of Carrot Top's "humor" makes it even worse.  The only entertainment one could possibly get from this movie is to burn it, smash it, or otherwise destroy it in an amusing fashion.  If you were to rank it against every movie ever made, it would be right between "Problem Child" and "Biodome".  Nuff said.
